DOC.brief_summary: This study will measure the engagement of people with epilepsy in a mobile phone based messaging platform as well as understand if there is an impact on their self-management
DOC.brief_title: Measure of Engagement of Epilepsy Patients in Messaging Groups
DOC.detailed_description: The primary purpose of this study is to assess a person with epilepsy's level of usage of a mobile messaging application for peer support. The secondary purpose is to understand what characteristics of their group drive different levels of usage and improvements in self-management. Participants will be placed in groups in a messaging application based on their life-circumstances or randomly. Participants can participate as much or little as they want for a minimum of six weeks. Participants will complete an initial and a final questionnaire.
DOC.criteria: Age, diagnosis of epilepsy, have access to a smartphone capable of running messaging application A diagnosis of learning disability/difficulty, significant mental health conditionsÍ¾ those in care, bereaved, or prisoners. Any other vulnerable individuals (individuals unable to protect themselves against significant harm or exploitation)
